reviews.review: Half-Life is a must play for anyone. It is over 15 years old, but is still worth playing. The only problem is that sometimes the controls can be too responsive. Trying to climb/get off ladders can become infuriating. Other than that one minor gripe, this game is incredible. Very fast paced and entertaining.

Obviously it's pretty outdated and everything but your into older games, want to know the HL story, or (like me when i bought this) have a crappy computer that can't handle much it's really good for the money. I loved how even though it is a FPS at heart there is still lots of parkour and adventuring elements
Very good storytelling throughout the game. Mechanics are a bit dated and some controls are hard to rememeber to use in certain situations. Overall 9/10

This is one of my favorite games from Valve. In my opinion, for a game from 1998 this is outstanding. I think that this game also has good replay value because of its great story.

Gameplay 10/10
Combat 10/10

Megan Fox and Kate Upton had a child it was a CD with Half Life on it, Half Life grew up and by the age of 6 he was on his 9th year at harvard. Half Life traveled to Africa to end hunger istead he accidentaly found the cure for aids and all cancers, dissapointed, he spent the next 6 minutes devoloping a new plan to cure hunger. He created an inflattable reusable plate of pizza/nachos/cheeseburger/orange chicken combination that touched every tastebud in the human mouth. After curing the world of stupidity, Half Life setteled down and retired and dicided to be the greatest video game of all time. Today Half Life is remembered for taking down every mexican drug cartel, and creating the loudest, most destructive, sparkfilled fireworks that are chemically impossible to start fires or kill organisms. So this week i got to play a game i have never played before that i really wanted to, it was this one of course, it really blew me away, I have heard great things about it before, but I finally got to experience it for myself, the graphics at the time it was made compared to now, still amaze me how they have achieved the graphics they used in '98 really speaks for valve, the storyline was AMAZING you could feel like you were in black mesa yourself, the excitement made me want to come back for more when i wanted to sleep, and the fact that they had a full fledged multiplayer capability at the time it was made really amazes me, yes Diablo 2 had multiplayer, but nothing like half-life, all in all, this is really an excellent game that lead to valve becoming a great gaming empire.
I can't believe how long it has taken me to finally buy and play this game. And obviously it has been a great experience playing this game.

Usually Duke Nukem or Samus Aran (From Metroid) But the people at Valve decided to make someone who isn't macho, who isn't a combat expert, and who isn't a guy that talks. Half-Life will always be one of the Top 100. Even though the graphics might not be good for 2013. I bet in 1998, people felt like they were playing as someone in real life. Picture this, Its 1998, you're a gamer who has all the must-own games of the 90s, you have nothing else to play. Then, a friend tells you about half life and how it's amazing and nothing like th games you own. For laughs, you decide to try it. What you experience, is a masterpeice in motion.

-The Graphics don't compare to the high resoloution graphics of today, but Back in 1998 it easily sets the high bar for graphics in that time, go look at other games released in 98. No comparison, Half life wins right off the bat.

-The story is one that any gamer, new fans or old, would be sucked into and not leave their chairs until it was done. You're a scientist who is involved in an experiment for a research company whidch goes horribly wrong and....I can't spoil the story for you. I don't want to ruin the HL experience.

-The Gameplay is self-explanitory when you play it. The pressure is on you the entire time, you have to use your brain to navigate through the game while at the same time, trying to keep yourself alive. A beautiful combination of A FPS and a puzzle game, something that had never been done before 1998.

-You WILL have the urge to replay this game over and over again, nuff said.

-The soundtrack changes mood like the game changes mood, which only causes anticipation and a mood setting enviorment.

FINAL SCORE: 97/100

Somehow I managed to avoid playing any of the Half-Life series over the last 15 years. I decided it was time to end this drought when I saw a sale on the Valve Collection and purchased 26 titles for €45. 

It can sometimes be tough to get into a very old game if you haven’t played it before, mainly due to the nostalgic factor being absent. Half-Life surprised me though. I enjoyed the entire adventure, bar one or two extremely frustrating parts that you wouldn’t see in modern games. Still, I was happy to overlook these flaws considering it’s age.

There isn’t much of a story, but there doesn’t need to be. Something bad has happened and you have to do something about it to survive. The game does a great job with pushing you along without making it extremely obvious what you have to do next. Everything is subtle, and it is easy to miss a few paths or tunnels that lead you to next chapter.

Graphically, its pleasant enough, although some textures are pretty low res which is to be expected. The audio quality is quite poor too, but it does just enough to be acceptable. I found the AI pretty good, with some enemies proving a real challenge. The scientists and guards that you must interact with also behave quite well when you need them to do something. It’s all very basic stuff but it just works.

The map does a very good job of making you feel like you aren’t on rails, even though you literally are for one chapter of the game. The game took longer to play through than I expected with some really cool challenging puzzles, but still nothing that would blow your mind by todays standards.

I would highly recommend this game to anyone. 15 years on it’s still a lot better than many games in it’s genre, both in terms of gameplay and feel. It is challenging and at times frustrating, but I believe it is essential to experience this piece of gaming history. 

9.4/10

Half Life is one of the best games I have had the privalege of playing, and one of the best first person shooters of its time. The combination of first person shooter action with intricate (and crafty) puzzle elements makes for great pacing as well as lethal entertainment.

The story is detailed, intricate, and cleverly told, never revealing too much, just enough. The graphics, though dated, hold up well enough to bring to life the frightening and fear inducing environments throughout the ill-fated Black Mesa. And beyond. And enhancing that, a creepy soundscape, an intimidating soundtrack. And then the silence. Nothing is quite so terrifying as nothing. Anticipation.

And the enemies, Half Life does not disappoint. Realistic in action, terrifying in appearance, jumping out when you least expect.

And what would a first person shooter be without an arsenal of weapons with which to shoot, blast, or pulvarize opponents? From shotguns to grenades to hi-tech prototypes that only a top secret research facility could supply. And the iconic crowbar.

What few flaws this game has, they are near invisible, overshadowed by its strengths.

A world of Adrenaline Fear awaits behind the rusted lid of pandora's box.

I recently decided to start playing the half-life games so this is not a review that looks through the eyes of nostalgia, i can honestly say that this game is a lot of fun. it has aged well and is still a very entertaining FPS in this "call of duty" era. it's more than just shooting the bad guys and moving on to the next room where more bad guys lie in wait, you have to think and make critical decisions about your next move which is something many modern FPS' are missing. however by FAR my favorite thing about it is the feel of adventure you get from the "there are no levels" game design. over all this is a terrific game i would recommend to any sci-fi/shooter fan.

There is a reason why this game is so widely praised and so notorious that people have categorized FPSes into pre-Half-Life and post Half-Life. This was one of the first FPS games where the story and the environments actually matter.

Story: You play as Gordon Freeman a scientist working for an Area 51 like scientific facility called Black Mesa. From the first scene where you are on a tram you see the parts of the underground Black Mesa facility that make you feel like a tiny rat in a big place. An accident occurs that causes dimensional rifts to open up to hostile aliens. You must escape from Black Mesa. But the story is not divided up into cut scenes with unredeemable villains and sinless heroes. As you explore the facility you find out that the people you trust: your government, fellow scientists, etc. are not telling you everything. 

Gameplay: The facility itself has interesting parts including a freezer, a rail tram system where you have to be cautious and stop to eliminate enemies, a nuclear reactor, and more. The environments and level design are very good. You get a large arsenal of weaponry that grows as you progress through the game. Interesting weapons include the Tau Cannon (chargeable cannon), the crossbow, and some alien weapons like killer bugs called Snarks. You are free to play how you want as the game gives you ammo for all your weapons on a regular basis. You have two types of enemies: the aliens and the HCEU (human soldiers). The latter might be a spoiler but it’s a trope anyways. As I said earlier the game makes you feel like a rat in a big place. You have to vault ladders, go through vents, scale mountains and more.

Ever since Half Life came out FPSes have gone the way of story driven gameplay rather than gameplay only. Some people might blame this game for that whenever they play a game where the gameplay is boring and is divided by cutscenes that you skip the second time around. Many of those games are great but one usually comes out that makes everyone say "Games were better before." What I can say is that Half Life is a great game and you should definitely pick it up.
